p: Immunotherapy with neutralizing antibodies present in convalescent plasma proved to be safe and during the SARS, MERS and 2009 H1N1 influenza epidemics [ 28, 29]. The feasibility of convalescent plasma transfusion to rescue severely ill patients with COVID-19 was explored in 10 patients in Wuhan, China. One dose (200 mL) of convalescent plasma was well tolerated, seemed to significantly improve clinical symptoms within 3 days and resulted in high-level neutralizing antibodies, leading to disappearance of viremia in 7 days. These results should be validated in larger cohorts, preferably with randomized trials [30].
